  • uint32 m_layerDrawingOrder [uint32(ItemTypes::numberOfItemTypes)]
    The order in which to draw the layers.

Detailed Description

Objects of this class describes the DrawingArea where the map is drawn.

The objects will also handle mouse-click etc. in the map.

Definition at line 41 of file MEMapArea.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

MEMapArea::MEMapArea (  OldGenericMap *  map,
uint8  filterLevel = 0
) 
 

Create a new MEMapArea for a given map.

Parameters:
map The map that contains all information (items etc.).
filterLevel The filter level to use when drawing the map. Default is 0 (draw all coordinates).

bool MEMapArea::getConnectionCosts (  OldConnection *  conn,
OldNode *  toNode,
uint32 &  costA,
uint32 &  costB,
uint32 &  costC,
uint32 &  costD,
bool  externalConnection = false
) 
 

Get the costs of one connection in the map.

Parameters:
conn The connection to get the costs for.
toNode The node where the connection is stored.
costA Outparameter that is set to costA of the connection.
costB Outparameter that is set to costB of the connection.
costC Outparameter that is set to costC of the connection.
costD Outparameter that is set to costD of the connection.
externalConnection True if the connection is an external connection (to/from an other map), false otherwise.

const char* MEMapArea::getMapCountryName (   ) 
 

Get the country name of the shown map.

Used for writing country in the comment field of extra data map correction records.

Returns:
The country name of the map in english. All space-chars are replaced with "_".

Get the layer with the street segments.

bool MEMapArea::highlightConnection (  uint32  toNodeID,
uint32  fromNodeID
) 
 

Highlight one connection in the map.

Parameters:
toNodeID The ID of the node that it is possible to drive to.
fromNodeID The ID of the node that it is possible to drive from.
Returns:
True if the connection is highlighted, false otherwise.

bool MEMapArea::highlightCoordinate (  int32  lat,
int32  lon,
Gdk::Color  color,
MEItemLayer::symbol_t  symbol = MEItemLayer::squareSymbol,
int  lineWidth = 2,
bool  redrawScreen = true
) 
 

Highlight one coordinate on the map, using the given values when highlighting.

Parameters:
lat The latitude to highlight.
lon The longitude to highlight.
color The color to draw with.
symbol The symbol to draw at the given coordinate.
lineWidth The linewidth to use when drawing the symbol (used when appropriate for the selected symbol).
redraw True if the map should be redraw, false otherwise.
Returns:
True if the coordinate is highlighted, false otherwise (e.g. the coordinate outside the current map).

bool MEMapArea::highlightCoordinates (  GfxData *  gfxData  ) 
 

Highlight all the coordinates in one GfxData.

Parameters:
gfxData The GfxData that will be highlighted.
Returns:
True if the coordinates are highlighted, false otherwise.

uint32 MEMapArea::highlightFromGdfID (  uint32  gdfFeatID  ) 
 

Returns:
Id of matched mcm ID if only one found, otherwise MAX_UINT32

bool MEMapArea::highlightItem (  uint32  id,
bool  clearFirst = true,
bool  locate = true,
bool  redrawScreen = true,
MEGdkColors::color_t  color = MEGdkColors::invalidColor
) 
 

Highlight one item on the map.

If the clearFirst-parameter is set to false this id will be added to the possible other items to highlight.

Parameters:
id The ID of the item to highlight.
clearFirst Before the given item is added, all other highlights are removed.
Returns:
True if the given id was found in the map among the existing layers and added to. This does not mean that the highlighted item is displayed with the current zoom.

void MEMapArea::verifyMaxMin (  int32 &  maxL,
int32 &  minL,
int32  delta,
int32  maxAllowedL,
int32  minAllowedL
)  [private]
 

Update the maximum and minimum values of the bounding box.

Used when to calculate new drawable items in the item layers.

Parameters:
maxL In/out-parameter that is set to the maximum, valid value of the latitude coordinate.
minL In/out-parameter that is set to the minimum valid value of the latitude coordinate.
maxAllowedL The maximum allowed latitude.
minAllowedL The minimum allowed latitude.
